Introduction to Machine Learning.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
Introduction to Machine Learning.description: This chapter introduces Machine Learning concepts, why ML matters, and how machines learn patterns from data.

details: Machine Learning enables computers to learn from data without explicit programming.
ML models identify patterns and make predictions or decisions.
Used in recommendation systems, fraud detection, NLP, self-driving cars, etc.
Algorithms learn mathematical relationships between inputs and outputs.
Model performance improves with more data and tuning.

sections.summary: Machine Learning helps build intelligent systems by learning from historical data and predicting future outcomes.

Types of Machine Learning.title: Types of Machine Learning
Types of Machine Learning.description: This chapter explains the categories of ML based on learning style: supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.

details: Examples: classification (spam detection), regression (house price prediction).
Model learns from unlabeled data by finding hidden patterns.
Used in robotics, gaming, autonomous systems.

sections.summary: Different learning types suit different applications — classification, clustering, control systems, and more.

Data Preprocessing.title: Data Preprocessing
Data Preprocessing.description: Data preprocessing improves data quality, making ML models accurate and reliable.

details: Impute using mean, median, or mode.
Min-Max scaling for transforming values to [0,1].
Train-test split ensures unbiased model evaluation.

sections.summary: Clean, well-processed data significantly improves ML model accuracy and stability.

Linear Regression.title: Linear Regression
Linear Regression.description: Linear Regression predicts continuous values by fitting a straight line to data.

details: Assumes linear relationship between input (X) and output (Y).
Mean Squared Error (MSE) measures prediction error.
Optimization method to update model weights.
Reduces cost function step by step.

sections.summary: Linear regression is the simplest and most widely used predictive modeling technique.

Logistic Regression.title: Logistic Regression
Logistic Regression.description: Logistic Regression is used for binary classification by modeling probabilities using the sigmoid function.

details: Predicts values between 0 and 1 using sigmoid activation.

sections.summary: Logistic Regression is fundamental for binary classification problems.

Decision Trees.title: Decision Trees
Decision Trees.description: Decision Trees split data into branches based on conditions, helping solve classification and regression tasks.

sections.summary: Decision trees are versatile and interpretable models for both regression and classification.

Support Vector Machines.title: Support Vector Machines
Support Vector Machines.description: SVMs classify data by finding the optimal hyperplane that separates classes with maximum margin.

details: SVM finds the best boundary between classes.
Maximizes the margin between support vectors.
Linear SVM works for linearly separable data.
Kernel trick helps classify non-linear data.

sections.summary: SVMs are powerful classifiers suitable for complex and high-dimensional datasets.

Clustering Algorithms.title: Clustering Algorithms
Clustering Algorithms.description: Clustering groups similar data points together without labeled data.

details: Centers updated using mean of points.
Forms a dendrogram for cluster visualization.

sections.summary: Clustering discovers natural groupings in data without requiring labels.

Model Evaluation.title: Model Evaluation
Model Evaluation.description: Model evaluation measures how well an ML model performs on unseen data using accuracy metrics and confusion matrix.

details: F1 Score — harmonic mean of precision and recall.
Solved using regularization, more data, tuning.

sections.summary: Evaluating ML models ensures reliability, fairness, and good real-world performance.

Neural Networks.title: Neural Networks
Neural Networks.description: Neural Networks simulate the human brain using interconnected neurons to model complex relationships.

details: Input layer → Hidden layers → Output layer.

sections.summary: Neural Networks form the base of modern deep learning systems powering AI applications.
